conclusion: There are two balls, P and Q, on a smooth horizontal platform. Ball P has mass M = 4m and no charge, while ball Q has mass m and a negative charge -q. There's a uniform magnetic field B perpendicular to the platform on the right side of the platform. Ball P is moving towards Q with an initial velocity v₀ = mg/(qB), and they collide elastically.
The problem requires finding the velocities of both balls after the collision.
Ball P is moving with velocity v₀ towards Q on a smooth horizontal platform.
Since the platform is smooth and horizontal, there are no frictional forces acting on the balls.
The only forces present are gravitational forces and, in the case of Q, the magnetic force once it enters the magnetic field.
Before the collision, both balls are outside the magnetic field, so only gravity affects them.
After the collision, Q will enter the magnetic field, so it will experience a magnetic force due to its velocity and charge.
Since the collision is elastic, both momentum and kinetic energy are conserved during the collision.
Use the conservation of momentum and conservation of kinetic energy to find the velocities of P and Q after the collision.
Let m_p = mass of P = 4m, m_q = mass of Q = m, v_p = velocity of P after collision, v_q = velocity of Q after collision.

premise: Conservation of momentum: m_p * v₀ = m_p * v_p + m_q * v_q
Conservation of kinetic energy: (1/2) m_p v₀² = (1/2) m_p v_p² + (1/2) m_q v_q²

conclusion: 2 m v₀² = 2 m v_p² + (1/2) m v_q²
